result.summary_1_page: The Samsung Galaxy S25 is a compact flagship featuring a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED display (1080p, 120Hz, up to 2600 nits peak brightness) powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, delivering top-tier performance (Geekbench 10050, AnTuTu 2193701). It retains the same camera setup as its predecessor (50MP main, 10MP 3x telephoto, 12MP ultra-wide), which receives mixed reviews for lacking hardware innovation but benefits from software enhancements. Battery endurance averages 13-15 hours of active use with a 4000mAh cell, though 25W wired charging is criticized as slow. The phone runs One UI 7 on Android 15 with a 7-year update promise. Its lightweight design (162g) features IP68 rating and Gorilla Glass Victus 2. Key strengths include its compact form factor, powerful performance, and long software support, while drawbacks include unchanged camera hardware, slow charging, and PWM display flickering noted in reviews.
pros: Compact and lightweight design ideal for one-handed use (GSMArena, PhoneArena)
Snapdragon 8 Elite chip delivers top-tier Android performance (GSMArena, NotebookCheck)
Bright 2600-nit AMOLED display with excellent outdoor visibility (DXOMark, Tom's Guide)
One UI 7 with 7 years of software updates (GSMArena, Android Central)
Premium build with IP68 rating and Gorilla Glass Victus 2 (Tom's Guide, TechRadar)
cons: Unchanged camera hardware since Galaxy S22 generation (GSMArena, Android Central)
Slow 25W wired charging vs competitors (GSMArena, TechRadar)
PWM display flickering at 240Hz causes eye strain (NotebookCheck, DXOMark)
Lacks UWB support for precise location tracking (Android Central, NotebookCheck)
128GB base storage with UFS 3.1 in entry model (GSMArena, PhoneArena)

attributes.name: Camera
attributes.explanation: Same 50MP+10MP+12MP setup as S24/S23. Software improvements praised but hardware criticized by GSMArena & Android Central. No DXOMark score available.

attributes.name: Battery Endurance
attributes.explanation: 13-15h active use (GSMArena 13:09h, Tom's Guide 15:43h). Efficient Snapdragon 8 Elite but small 4000mAh capacity limits longevity.

attributes.name: Performance
attributes.explanation: Geekbench 10050, AnTuTu 2.19M. Snapdragon 8 Elite leads Android flagships but throttles under sustained load (NotebookCheck, GSMArena).

attributes.name: Display
attributes.explanation: DXOMark 157 display score. 2600-nit peak brightness praised but PWM dimming at 240Hz noted by NotebookCheck & DXOMark.

attributes.name: Software Experience
attributes.explanation: One UI 7 with 7-year updates. Some bloatware present but AI features and DeX praised (GSMArena, Android Central).

attributes.name: Design & Build
attributes.explanation: 162g weight, IP68 rating, and matte aluminum frame. Gorilla Glass Victus 2 (not Armor) noted by GSMArena & Tom's Guide.

attributes.name: Longevity Value
attributes.explanation: 7-year support excellent but $799 price criticized by PhoneArena & TechRadar. Strong resale expected.
